pages.text: of everything which ye ask Him, giveth He to you; and if ye would reckon up the favours of God, ye cannot count them! Surely man is unjust, ungrateful
ABRAHAM said, "O Lord make this land secure, and turn aside me and my children from serving idols
For many men, O my Lord, have they led astray. But whosoever shall follow me, he truly shall be of me; and whosoever shall disobey me. . . . Thou truly art Gracious, Merciful

O our Lord! verily I have settled some of my offspring in an unfruitful valley, nigh to thy holy house; O our Lord, that they may strictly observe prayer! Make thou therefore the hearts of men to yearn toward them, and supply them with fruits that they may be thankful
O our Lord! thou truly knowest what we hide and what we bring to light; nought on earth or in heaven is hidden from God
Praise be to God who hath given me, in my old age, Ismael and Isaac! My Lord is the hearer of prayer
Lord! grant that I and my posterity may observe prayer. O our Lord! and grant this my petition
O our Lord! forgive me and my parents and the faithful, on the day wherein account shall be taken
Think thou not that God is regardless of the deeds of the wicked. He only respiteth them to the day on which all eyes shall stare up with terror
